      • addRenderable

        public void addRenderable(GLRenderable r,
                 int pos)
        Registers the GLRenderable object with this GLRenderControl to be rendered on screen. The render(GLHandle,float) method will be called to draw to the OpenGL canvas.
        Parameters:
        r - the GLRenderable object to be called when rendering.
        pos - the position in the rendering queue to be placed. 0 is the first to be rendered on each frame and LAST is provided as a convenience field to insert at position size - 1 (aka the end of the queue, thus last to be rendered on each frame).

      • removeRenderable

        public void removeRenderable(GLRenderable r)
        Removes the GLRenderable object from the queue, if it exists.
        Parameters:
        r - removes the GLRenderable from the queue.

      • setMaxUpdates

        public void setMaxUpdates(int maxUpdates)
        Sets the max number of times updates can be issued before a render must occur. If animations are "chugging" or skipping, it may help to set this value to a very low value (1-2). Higher values will prevent the game updates from freezing.
        Specified by:
        setMaxUpdates in interface RenderController
        Parameters:
        maxUpdates - max number of updates to be sent before rendering.

      • getGLWindow

        public com.jogamp.newt.opengl.GLWindow getGLWindow()

        public void copyRenderablesTo(GLRenderControl rc)

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Disposes of this GLRenderControl and all of its internally held resources with the exception of the GLWindow object responsible for the GLContext. Subsequent calls to a disposed GLRenderControl's methods will result in errors. This method blocks for a maximum of five seconds or until the GLRenderLoop successfully completes its shutdown operations.
